018package com.scivicslab.actoriac.accumulator;
019
020import java.io.PrintStream;
021import java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicInteger;
022
023import com.scivicslab.pojoactor.core.accumulator.Accumulator;
024
025/**
026 * Accumulator that outputs to the console (System.out/System.err).
027 *
028 * <p>This accumulator writes output directly to the console as it arrives.
029 * It supports different output types:</p>
030 * <ul>
031 *   <li>{@code cowsay} - Rendered cowsay ASCII art (output as-is)</li>
032 *   <li>{@code stdout} - Command stdout (output as-is)</li>
033 *   <li>{@code stderr} - Command stderr (output to System.err)</li>
034 * </ul>
035 *
036 * <h2>Usage</h2>
037 * <pre>{@code
038 * ConsoleAccumulator console = new ConsoleAccumulator();
039 * console.add("node-1", "stdout", "command output line");
040 * console.add("workflow", "cowsay", renderedCowsayArt);
041 * }</pre>
042 *
043 * @author devteam@scivics-lab.com
044 * @since 2.12.0
045 */
046public class ConsoleAccumulator implements Accumulator {
047
048    /**
049     * Filter mode for console output.
050     */
051    public enum FilterMode {
052        /** Output all messages (default) */
053        ALL,
054        /** Output nothing (equivalent to --quiet) */
055        NONE,
056        /** Output only report messages (type="report") */
057        REPORT_ONLY
058    }
059
060    private final PrintStream stdout;
061    private final PrintStream stderr;
062    private final AtomicInteger count = new AtomicInteger(0);
063    private volatile boolean quiet = false;
064    private volatile FilterMode filterMode = FilterMode.ALL;
065
066    /**
067     * Constructs a ConsoleAccumulator with default System.out and System.err.
068     */
069    public ConsoleAccumulator() {
070        this(System.out, System.err);
071    }
072
073    /**
074     * Constructs a ConsoleAccumulator with custom output streams.
075     *
076     * @param stdout the stream for stdout output
077     * @param stderr the stream for stderr output
078     */
079    public ConsoleAccumulator(PrintStream stdout, PrintStream stderr) {
080        this.stdout = stdout;
081        this.stderr = stderr;
082    }
083
084    /**
085     * Sets quiet mode. When quiet, no output is written.
086     *
087     * @param quiet true to suppress output, false to enable output
088     */
089    public void setQuiet(boolean quiet) {
090        this.quiet = quiet;
091    }
092
093    /**
094     * Returns whether quiet mode is enabled.
095     *
096     * @return true if quiet mode is enabled
097     */
098    public boolean isQuiet() {
099        return quiet;
100    }
101
102    /**
103     * Sets the filter mode for console output.
104     *
105     * @param mode the filter mode to use
106     */
107    public void setFilterMode(FilterMode mode) {
108        this.filterMode = mode;
109        // Sync with quiet flag for backwards compatibility
110        this.quiet = (mode == FilterMode.NONE);
111    }
112
113    /**
114     * Returns the current filter mode.
115     *
116     * @return the current filter mode
117     */
118    public FilterMode getFilterMode() {
119        return filterMode;
120    }
121
122    @Override
123    public void add(String source, String type, String data) {
124        // Apply filter based on mode
125        switch (filterMode) {
126            case NONE:
127                count.incrementAndGet();
128                return;
129            case REPORT_ONLY:
130                if (!"report".equals(type)) {
131                    count.incrementAndGet();
132                    return;
133                }
134                break;
135            case ALL:
136            default:
137                if (quiet) {
138                    count.incrementAndGet();
139                    return;
140                }
141                break;
142        }
143
144        if (data == null || data.isEmpty()) {
145            count.incrementAndGet();
146            return;
147        }
148
149        // Format output with fixed-width source prefix on each line
150        String output = formatOutput(source, data);
151
152        switch (type) {
153            case "stderr":
154                stderr.print(output);
155                break;
156            case "cowsay":
157            case "stdout":
158            default:
159                stdout.print(output);
160                break;
161        }
162        count.incrementAndGet();
163    }
164
165    /**
166     * Formats the output with a fixed-width source prefix on each line.
167     *
168     * <p>Every line of output is prefixed with {@code [source]} where source
169     * is left-justified in a fixed-width field. This allows multi-line output
170     * (such as cowsay ASCII art) to remain properly aligned while still being
171     * identifiable by source.</p>
172     *
173     * <p>Example output:</p>
174     * <pre>
175     * [node-web-01    ] command output here
176     * [workflow       ]  _______________________
177     * [workflow       ] < Starting workflow... >
178     * [workflow       ]  -----------------------
179     * </pre>
180     *
181     * @param source the source identifier (e.g., "node-web-01", "cli")
182     * @param data the output data (may contain multiple lines)
183     * @return the formatted output string with prefix on each line
184     */
185    private String formatOutput(String source, String data) {
186        String prefix = formatPrefix(source);
187        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
188
189        String[] lines = data.split("\n", -1);
190        for (int i = 0; i < lines.length; i++) {
191            sb.append(prefix).append(lines[i]);
192            if (i < lines.length - 1) {
193                sb.append("\n");
194            }
195        }
196        sb.append("\n");
197
198        return sb.toString();
199    }
200
201    /**
202     * Creates a prefix from the source name.
203     *
204     * @param source the source identifier
205     * @return formatted prefix like "[node-web-01] "
206     */
207    private String formatPrefix(String source) {
208        String src = (source != null) ? source : "";
209        return "[" + src + "] ";
210    }
211
212    @Override
213    public String getSummary() {
214        return "ConsoleAccumulator: " + count.get() + " entries written to console";
215    }
216
217    @Override
218    public int getCount() {
219        return count.get();
220    }
221
222    @Override
223    public void clear() {
224        count.set(0);
225    }
226}
